Jonathan Gossage wrote:

>I get the same results as you do on 3.7 if I put in the synchronization
>statements that I described in my previous post, otherwise I get the results
>that I described there. There is a complex test fixture involved here as
>well as a smart card monitor thread in the classes under test, but it is
>easy to distinguish the messages from the monitor thread from the messages
>from the test cases themselves.
>

I assume your testXXX() methods invoke methods that spawn threads and 
your logging statements are in those methods under test, correct?

My point is that JUnit out of the box does not spawn threads for 
testXXX() methods.
 
Mike
